description:
**Description**:</br>
Given the root of a binary tree, find its maximum depth. The maximum depth is the number of nodes along the longest path from the root node down to the farthest leaf node.

**`Input:`**</br>
`The input consists of a root node of a binary tree.`

**`Output:`**</br>
`Return an integer representing the maximum depth of the binary tree.`

**`Example:`**</br>
**`Input:`**
```
        3
       / \
      9  20
        /  \
       15   7
```
**`Output:`**  
 ```3```   
  
**`Explanation:`**</br>
`The maximum depth is 3, which is the distance from the root node (3) to the farthest leaf node (15 or 7).`

**Constraints**:</br>
•	`The number of nodes in the tree is in the range [0, 10^4].`</br>
•	`-100 <= Node.val <= 100`
title: Maximum Depth of Binary Tree

code_skeletons.skeleton_define_class:

    public int maxDepth(TreeNode root) {
